Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: ReginaPittsburghPa_
Reviews.Content: If you are going to the Chelsea section of NYC, I highly recommend this centrally located hotel, just two blocks from Eataly and close to other attractions. We stayed in a basic two double bed room which was clean and large enough for three adult ladies. The front desk was very friendly, accommodating and can store your luggage for the day when you checkout. They offer complimentary coffee and bagels/sweet breads in the morning. (and the coffee was excellent!) Would stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Could be even excellent but......”
Reviews.Author: evdokimos
Reviews.Content: Amazing position, very good clean and safe place, excellent value for money but.... I don't understand why they need to give you their WORST room whenever you book through the net... so if you want to book this GREAT place don't forget to ask them for a room that faces 23rd st. or 7th av. so that you don't end up to the oppressed rooms that look at the backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cat241
Reviews.Content: This New York City hotel located in Chelsea may only rate two stars but the location makes up for the outdated decor. I can mostly say positive things about this hotel. I am a firm believer that when going to New York you shouldn't be spending too much time in your room. My basic requirements are a clean room, working temperature control and working plumbing ( I do not want to be fiddling with trying to get my shower to work). The Chelsea Savoy Hotel meets these requirements. The Chelsea Savoy is in perfect location - inbetween uptown and downtown which makes cab rides fairly inexpensive and if you choose not to take a cab there a several subway lines in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reservation system”
Reviews.Author: JasonCA_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago and liked it, but recently tried to book again. They don't have online booking (pretty strange in 2012), so you email and they send a price. They asked me to email back with my credit card. Since, for security, I didn't want to send my card number by email I called the hotel to book directly. She quoted me a much higher rate, and when I said they had emailed me a better rate she refused to honor it. Apparently the low rate is only available to people willing to risk sending their cc info by email. So I booked a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location”
Reviews.Author: M0gwai993
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in NY for new year. Hotel is in a good location right off 7th avenue. Subway station across road but we found it easy enough to walk everywhere. The room was clean and reasonably sized. Decor is nothing special but I was expecting that. We were in a room at the front which meant we had view of Empire State building but was noisy, especially at night and early morning. Staff were helpful, check in and out easy and we stored our luggage there for the day after we checked out. Coffee, tea, bagels and muffins provided in morning. Toiletries and hairdryer in room. No free wifi which would have been nice but there is a Starbucks just up 7th Ave which has free wifi. Overall our stay in the hotel was fine and definitely good value for price we paid but next time I would either request a room at the back and hope its quieter or stay in a different hotel on a quieter street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent/Affordable Place for a NYC Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MNGal31
Reviews.Content: Pros of the Chelsea Savoy: Clean, good-sized rooms. Our room was very quiet (was not facing the street). Very affordable for NYC with no creepy bed bugs, mold, extra small rooms, etc. Has nice amenities such as a flat screen TV, hair dryer, ipod docking station, etc. In a good location, lots of subway stations close by. Some fun places to check out close by including a great place called Eataly and the flatiron district. 20 minute walk to Times Square. There is also coffee and bagels/rolls every morning. I would stay there again. Cons of the Chelsea Savoy: Thin blankets, it was cold at night. When we asked for extra blankets, they brough extra comforters, not actual thermal blankets. Hit and miss staff. We had a flight leaving at 6:00 pm, I called and asked the front desk if they could arrange a car to pick us up. The person I talked to was very unhelpful as far as what time the car should arrive (he kept asking me what time we wanted to leave and I told him I didn't know, that our flight was at 6:00, asked him what did he suggest). He was also very unclear on the cost of the car. He told me one thing over the phone, when we got back to the hotel to wait for the car, we asked to confirm the price again and he called the company. They told him one price, when the car arrived, the driver said another price. The driver/front desk then seemed to get into an argument. It was very...odd. I guess I would think/hope that the front desk of a hotel would be more knowledgeable about things like airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Skibug_10
Reviews.Content: We had four to the room (to keep New York hotel costs somewhat reasonable) and it held us well though I wouldn't call the room spacious. We had a room on the inside and away from the sound of traffic and had great sleep every night. They have complimentary coffee and pastries in the morning (I liked the chewy bagels). If that is you fancy a Starbucks one is just across the road and a grocery store is less than half a block away. The best part of the hotel is it is relatively close to the three subway lines with one right at the hotels location so it is easy to get to all parts of Manhattan including Times Square to the north and the Financial District to the south. The staff were friendly and helpful. Don’t expect this to be the best hotel you have ever stayed in, but for its location and price range, it will get you a good sleep and off on the road to the many sites of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mattden
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Chelsea Savoy from 27 October - 2 November. The best thing going for the hotel is the location: in the middle of Chelsea and close to a number of subway lines. Check-in and check-out were fine but the staff can generally be described as surly and dis-interested. The room itself was reasonably sized by NY standards (read: small but not tiny) and clean-ish. Wifi is available via an external provider but is expensive (ie. $35 for 5 days) and restrictive (one device only at any one time).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and location”
Reviews.Author: familyofthreeboys
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. We are a family of five so they offered to bring us a cot at no extra charge. We arrived early in the day from our cruise and the hotel also stored our luggage until check in time at no extra charge. The breakfast is bagels, Muffins and coffee. We were right around the corner from The Whole Food Market which gives you healthy snacks. The big screen TV was great although no children's channel. Overall it was perfect for our needs. Free Wifi would be added bonus but then price might go up. It was right next to a subway station and handy to all the major attractions we wanted to see. Walking distance to Madison Square Gardens for my husband and oldest son to catch the NYR game. It is handy to the Chelsea Market and Times Square/ Theatre district,close enough to Empire State Building. Highly recommend it for those that want clean, comfortable room, friendly service for great value. This leaves you with money to spend on the attractions, shows, shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty nice rooms, I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Happyfeet12
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close walking distance to the Chelsea markets, meatpacking district, and times square. To the people complaining about noise... Why stay in NY if noise annoys you?? It really isn't bad. Skip the breakfast- way better places to eat in the city.. The front desk staff are not the most helpful, and I think the hotel should offer free wifi, that was a bit of a hassle. But other than that, definitely enjoyed the stay and would return for sure, can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJoan
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel, but the price is right. It is perfectly adequate if you do not plan to spend a lot of time in your room. The room is clean and comfortable, although a more comfortable chair would have been nice. The front desk was helpful and we found the location very nice as Chelsea has some very good restaurants nearby, and it is not that far from the major tourist attractions. The breakfast was disappointing, but there are great breakfast places very close by. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Mpas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week, upon a recommendation of a colleague. Overall I liked the place. We got the double room. I'll list the pros and cons in my opinion: Room: Cons: when we got there the room was not smelling very good, but it was clean. The smell may come from the carpet. The other days we could still smell it but we tried to keep the windows opened during the day Pros: the room size is ok. It has a TV, small fridge, alarm clock with Ipod/iphone connection, small safe in the closet About the noise, we were in the last floor facing the street. We could hear some noise eventually during the night or early in the morning, but that did not prevent us from sleeping well. Bathroom Pros: the size is big, they have clean towels changed every day, hairdryer and amennities (shampoo, soap, etc) Cons: the shower is fixed too low in the wall. So if you are over 1.75m height you may have to flex your knees to fit under the shower and wash your hair for example. Location: For us the location was very convenient, since we used the subway as our main transport method during our stay and there is a subway station a few steps away. Also, there are a lot of places to eat nearby. We tried Highpoint (recommended), there is Starbucks, there is Whole Foods Market (amazing place to buy fruits, fresh juice and groceries) Breakfast The free breakfast is only coffee/tea and some bagels/muffins. We had breakfast there only once. There are so many nice delis to have breakfast in NY, that we chose to spend a few dollars and have a nice breakfast somewhere else (Bread Factory - next to Macy's is very nice, or go to a Magnolia Bakery (Rockfeller Center or Bleeker St) and start your day with a delicious and famous cupcake) Wifi Internet at the hotel is not free, you have to pay for it. Or go outside and use the wifi from the place you will have breakfast (many many places in NY have free wi-fi) Staff I had read some complaints about the staff but we didn't have any problem with them. The girls who stayed during the morning period were more friendly than the guys who did the night shift, but they were not unpolite or rude to us anytme.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about trying a new hotel as i've always stayed at 4 stars hotels and higher while visiting NYC before but being now married and on a budget, i thought i'd give this hotel a try. Simply put, we liked it alot!!!! Room was good size especially for NYC, nice TV and the bathroom was one of the cleanest i've ever been in for a hotel. The staff was courteous (my only interaction was when i checked in), and the location of the hotel was perfect! Plenty of bars and restaurants, theatre district and even MSG but a short walk away and you're right next to a subway stop which is definitely a big plus! I've seen other reviewers complain about the noise level, but if you're going to the Big Apple for peace and quiet...then you've chosen the wrong city! We'll definitely be back and especially at that price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: nfp147
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Savoy is in a great neighborhood and very convenient to a couple of different subway lines. The size of the rooms are generous by NYC standards and are very well priced. The front desk staff isn't overly friendly, but our check-in process was seamless and quick. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep in a great location, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy and almost impossible to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Segaboyno
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October 2011, and will never return. The noise from the streets is a major problem, and enough to keep you awake all night long. The wafer-thin windows desperately need addressing, and to make matters worse, the curtains didn't fully close - meaning that bright light was shining in all night long. In addition, the front desk staff were unfriendly and not welcoming in any way. This is way overpriced and not worth a moment's consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Have no complaints! Everything was OK.”
Reviews.Author: leopardobx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a leisure trip to NYC for 4 nights in September. Have no complaints! Everything was OK. I had a few questions to ask the front desk staff and they answered them with no problem and the bell hop helped take our luggage up to room. They held our luggage until we were able to check in later in the afternoon. Rooms are a decent size, bathrooms are nice & spacious, windows open with a view of the street life in Chelsea. Room was clean. Close to 3 different subway lines. One thing to note, there are no free Wi-fi points close enough to get on from the hotel so if you are going to need internet you will have to pay for access.

Reviews.Title: “what deceit”
Reviews.Author: gomma
Reviews.Content: friends from France were staying with us for 2 weeks apart from 2 days in Manhattan. They booked with hotels.com and prepaid well over $200 per night for a room for 4 [2 adults and 2 children] with breakfast. On arrival they were shown a room with 1 double bed. After protesting they were shown another with 2 beds. Breakfast was not initially available; they were told the hotel had run out. After insisting that breakfast was included, they were rudely told they would have to wait as someone was out purchasing more food. Finally, they were offered pastries. unfortunately they left with a poor impression of New York hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Has as much charm as an urban automatic public toilet. Get out within 15 mins if you can.”
Reviews.Author: alicefilbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in Sept, would have booked out after the first had it been possible but unfortunately we had paid for everything upfront. What a depressing atmosphere! The menacing dark-haired staff guard reception much as the two dogs in The Omen guard Damien. No greetings, just menacing looks. At least it made us walk around Manhattan for 12 hours a day as we didn't want to go back there. I'd say it was the hotel equivalent of an urban automatic public W.C. Go in, do your stuff and get out, without making eye contact with anyone. It really has that much charm. The assistant manager Monica (dark-haired European) needs a rabies shot. She shouted at us like we'd stolen her purse when we asked for some cold water to be made available for breakfast. I don't think I've ever been spoken to so rudely in a customer-client situation. Whoever owns this hotel and has made an effort to provide nice facilities, please get rid of her. She's totally letting your business down and probably depressing the hell out of the other staff who look miserable. Read the Tripadvisor reviews, she's unprofessional. Pros for a 2 star hotel: Room good size, nice TV, bed ok, Bathroom- excellent water pressure and heat for the shower, nice products, shaving mirror, good towels etc. Cons: Location- on the corner of 23rd, the noise is DEAFENING. It's well connected to public transport but so are many much cheaper hotels, I now realise after my visit.Be warned, you'll need earplugs for every minute you spend in the room. Very Romantic!! The Reception Staff: Only approach the blondes!! They are pretty helpful but in general, moral is clearly low and they clearly don't want to be at work making the atmosphere really miserable. The only person who smiled at us all week was the poor guy polishing and dragging bags around. Breakfast. Don't pay for a continental like we did as it doesn't exist. In reality, there's coffee and muffins (Europeans don't touch any of it!) and a vending machine in hell's waiting room. Go to Starbucks across the road, it's no real effort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average, but very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: mdpas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September of 2011 and found the rooms to be reasonably clean and somewhat spacious for a New York Hotel. We stayed 3 or 4 people to a room and did not have a problem with space. The amenities were pretty much non existent; but for the price we paid it was not a problem. Room rates included cable tv (flat screen), free local calls, and wi-fi was available at an additional cost. Location was good as it was close to the Meatpacking district and only a 20 minute walk from Times Square, Little Italy, and Broadway. There is a Red #1 Subway line right on the corner as well. Depends on who you go with, but I would potentially stay here again; staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: XPLOR
Reviews.Content: Have you ever experienced this in New York? The doorman welcomes you into the lobby of your hotel and you are very impressed at the spacious elegance and design of the place. Then you enter your room and have to turn sideways to get past the bed and into the bathroom that you can't turn around in. Well, the Chelsea Savoy is nothing like that. From the outside the hotel is rather nondiscript. Once we found the entrance, we entered a clean, well lit space with a small front desk and two elevators. Nothing fancy, but totally effecient. When we entered the room we were really quite surprised at just how big it was. We had our 14 yr. old grand-daughter with us and we had been telling her how small New York hotel rooms can be. This place made it look like we didn't really know what we were talking about. The bathroom was also bigger than the norm and the price was certainly a deal as far as we were concerned. The staff wasn't overly friendly but they were always cordial and professional. There is a small dining area connected to the lobby where coffee and various bagels and muffins were available each morning. The hotel is located right on top of the 23rd and 7th Ave. trains so it's easy to get to and from anywhere. As is the case anywhere in New York, there are tons of places to eat within easy walking distance but we found one really good spot just half a block south on 7th Ave called Highpoint Bistro and Bar. The food was very creatively prepared, and served, and the prices were well within reason. I had the Burger and Beer lunch special for $10, my wife had the Avacado BLT for $8 with house made chips and our granddaughter had Buffalo Chicken Lollipops with a side of Crazy Corn. This is no run of the mill bistro. Anyway, with all this hotel has to offer at such a reasonable price we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but soulless.”
Reviews.Author: Tessington
Reviews.Content: Room was large but window was at end of an off shoot which made it like a tomb. Very clean. Towels small and rough. Staff were okay. Brilliant area to stay in but not a good room to come home to. We'd been advised to ask for a room off the main street by another guest as they couldn't sleep for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in the heart of Manattan”
Reviews.Author: Allan027
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea is a rare deal for a two-star hotel in the middle of Manhattan. For two beds the charge was $145/night + taxes. In August, you're lucky to find anything under $200. I've stayed in two- and three-star hotels around Manhattan, so I have those experiences to use as a measuring stick. Pros: Spacious room. I've stayed in tiny three-star hotels, so I was pleasantly surprised. Attentive staff: I've read complaints about rudeness, but I didn't encounter this problem. They let me and my traveling partner leave our bags in the morning and check in later when our room was cleaned. They offered a band-aid when we asked for one. They looked up the locations of sights without hesitation. Clean: No bugs. Good chambermaid service. Clean towels. Toiletries (shampoo, lotion, etc.) daily re-stocked. Fresh towels. Breakfast: Okay, it's only bagels, muffins and croissants plus coffee, but it's a good start to the day, and there are lots of nearby restos to grab eggs, etc. Location: 23rd/7th which means you access to different subway lines on this block. You can walk south the Greenwich Village, Chinatown, etc., or north to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, etc. Shower: Great water pressure. Clean taps, etc. Cons: A little noisy: I was on the 3rd floor facing 7th and you can hear sirens at night. AC: A little slow. The air con has a limited range in temperature, so you have to run it for a while to cool the room. Washroom: lacks a fan/ventilator. A minor quibble. No gym or business center. You have to pay $10/day for WiFi. My advice: Go to the public library across the street during business hours or the local Starbucks. Overall, I was happy with my stay here and would consider coming again. Advice: Call the hotel directly for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Business Hotel near Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: anirbanzz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a night in June. I picked it based on the reviews at Tripadvisor and my choice was right. The main advantage is its location. Its at 10 min walking distance from the Penn station. One can also easily walk upto the Times square from the hotel. The room was good, clean. The breakfast did not have much choices, but was good. The front desk was very prompt and informative. Location wise its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Looking to save money?”
Reviews.Author: brenbri
Reviews.Content: Ok, if you are used to a big fancy hotel with a fancy lobby, keep looking. If you are looking for a very affordable room, $130 a night for us, in a great location, start booking. This hotel is small, and has basically no amenities, but the location can't be beat. 20 blocks to Time Square or Little Italy. High Line Park and Hudson River Park are also close. Many subway lines are within two blocks and if you don't mind walking a couple a miles a day, you can walk everywhere from here. The rooms leave a lot to be desired. They are small and very basic, but NYC is the city that never sleeps. If you care about having a big nice room, then you aren't seeing enough of NYC. Many great little restaurants just south on 7th Ave. Would highly recommend for someone looking for a clean affordable place to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with this staff”
Reviews.Author: slllopes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my girlfriend, brother and his wife. Really liked hotel location and found room size to be all right. Was incredibly insulted by the front desk lady, who called me on the room and woke me up saying that I was lying to her about my brother having called a cab. I've never seen anyone so unprepared for dealing with public! Among the 3 other guys in the front desk I spoke to, 2 were also very unfriendly. It seemed that I was disturbing their peace every time I needed to ask a question. If you have to stay there, ask for a room that doesn't face the street, or you'll wake up with the noise. Stayed in the 3rd floor and it was impossible to sleep. Room safe was tiny. Don't recommend staying there if you expect to see smiles from any of the hotel workers.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: malrose13
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel for the price. Breakfast was not advertised and just as well because it was not so good. Friendly staff. Very flexible and very nice rooms. Will come back again anytime. Love the district Chelsea in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ganks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea Savoy hotel for 2 nights in July 2011. I was with my wife, 2 year old and 8 week old daughter. The hotel got us a portable crib that was clean and perfect for my 2 year old. You should know going in that this is nowhere close to a luxury hotel. It is a basic hotel without a ton of amenties. This worked perfectly for us because we had friends two blocks away. If you are looking for a clear place to stay in a great location, then this is the hotel for you. The free continental breakfast was basic but a nice touch. Don't expect amenities like a business center, gym, day spa, etc. The location is great right above the 1,2,3 subway line and a block away from the A,C,E. We sayed in a king room for $155/night. The room was very clean and fairly well appointed. The room had a minifridge, desk, flatscreen TV, air conditioning and a standard bathroom with clean towels, shampoo and soap. There is daily maid service and the maintenance staff came up very quickly when are A/C stopped working. Overall this is a very solid hotel for New York City. The price is right and the location ideal for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, well-located and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: BTfromSF
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at the Chelsea Savoy. I've grown addicted to its near-perfect location near 3 uptown/downtown subway routes (on 6th, 7th and 8th Avenues) and a crosstown bus route (on 23rd St.). On previous occasions, I became acquainted with the somewhat brusque attitude of the front desk staff mentioned by numerous other reviewers. This time seemed different, however. They were much more friendly and, for the first time, let me into my room well before the "official" 3 PM check-in time. The Chelsea Savoy's building looks of 60s vintage. That's a lot newer than many New York hotels. Yes, it could use a little TLC here and there, but it's basically in decent shape. The lobby is very small. There are no extra facilities like spas and workout rooms. They do provide "Continental Breakfast" in the lobby but I've actually never eaten it since I visit New York mostly to eat at its many restaurants outside my hotel. The CS's rooms are also fairly small (not cramped) but they all face the street (none in a light well that I've encountered) and seem to sport new flat panel TVs this year. Bed linens are inexpensive but serviceable and no evidence of bedbugs. Wireless internet is available but not free (I paid $35 for 5 days) In short, this is a great place if you are coming to New York to explore the town, not your hotel, and want a place mainly to change clothes, take rest breaks and sleep. I stayed there Monday through Friday (5 nights) for under $800. In NYC,you can't beat that for a clean modern place with a stick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelingdan1975
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean, no bed bugs. The view from the room was not the best but other than that nothing negative to say. This hotel is within walking distance to Penn station and times square. and a quick cab ride to tons of restaurants and great bars. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: punishment_ar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea Savoy for one night while in NYC. The location is very convenient for exploring Manhattan, there are two subway stations within a block. If you are driving in, there is a parking garage less than a block away. There are also tons of restaurants, markets, and shops in the area. We arrived early and our room was ready so they let us check in. The room was clean and well-stocked. On the day we left, they let us leave our luggage for several hours while we went out. The only bad thing I can say is that the beds were a little hard, but we were so tired, it didn't matter! I would highly recommend the Chelsea Savoy.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: bosbes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in november. The front desk was very nice, reservation via their site went great and we could pay cash upon arrival. Got a room on the third floor on the 23rd street side, for NYC it was quiet never slept better in NYC no earplugs needed ! Clean bathroom, great shower, enough space for all our luggage, even a closet we didn't use. Shampoo, soap, lotion and even mouth wash available. A free USA Today every morning and a large flat screen tv. Wifi costs $ 4,- a day. Clean sheets and pillows, room was made up every day. Never heard other guests, breakfast available buns, muffins and bagels. Really great to have the possibily to eat and drink something before going out. Also Wholefoods market and Jamba Juice is one block from the hotel. It is a relatively small hotel and I really liked it, the staff gave the feeling knowing you and they had a good luggage room system on the last day. The only thing I didn't like was the matras which was covered with a plastic layer, I understand the reason why they do that and off course I appreciate their choice for hygiene but it felt a bit like sleeping on an air bed or something. But well, after one night you don't feel it anymore. Location is great, it is in between the blue (to JFK) and red metro line and right in the middle of everything lots of things in walking distance. Also if you like going to the movies after a long day of walking in NYC there is a cinema in the same block ! I like to try different hotels everywhere I go, but I am quite sure I will go here again next time !

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing in New York.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: New York is a big city and hotels will be more expensive. We believe we found a good balance between cost and quality with the location being the overall convincing factor. We would stay here again but you need to place everything into perspective. This is not 5 star accommodation. That said it offers rooms that are spacious by big city standards. They are a little older and therefore not bright and shiny but everything that was needed worked. We did ask for a couple of lamps to be replaced and this did not happen. It did not prevent us from using all the room features. Breakfast offered amounted to a croissant and coffee downstairs but this was a little inconsistent. Again don't expect the world and you will not be disappointed. The location was superb and we walked all over New York. It is central enough to be able to get to any of the sights and back easily and is right next to the Red line on the underground. The staff were friendly enough but a bit detached.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great value!”
Reviews.Author: ejk_travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in Sept. and were pleasantly surprised...wonderng what such a reasonable rate would offer. We were able to store our luggage when we arrived before the room was ready; and when we did get to our room, it was small but clean and comfortable. The front desk staff was professional, the housekeeping staff was very accommodating and the continental breakfast (especially the danish) was sufficient. The Garden of Eden grocery store just across the street was very handy and the subway station just a few steps away at the corner allowed us to get anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes. We would stay here again and would take more time to explore the Chelsea neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal!'”
Reviews.Author: Tourist028
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and had a very pleasant stay. We traveled with friends and they had an identical room. The rooms were small but were clean and comfortable. We were on the fourth floor and could open our window. We loved the sounds of the city! The price was great and included a continental breakfast with coffee, bagels, and muffins. There is a subway stop right on the corner and we made our way around the city easily. There are two great markets with a block and half. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: sarah3328
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. I stayed Sept 11- 15, 2010 with friends. We had 2 rooms, one with one double bed, and the other room with two double beds. The room with the 2 beds was considerably larger (understandably) but both were good. The rooms were somewhat noisy from being very close to the street but that's to be expected when you're on the second story. The rooms were always clean and the bathroom quite spacious. The hairdryer in our room worked surprisingly well, in hindsight it was a waste of space in my bags to pack my own. Our room didn't have a fridge which was a bit of a downside when having drinks or food in the room, but there is ice that can be used if necessary. We only attempted the continental breakfast on our first day, it was bagels and muffins. We couldn't find a toaster and it didn't look that appetizing so we walked down the street to Dunkin donuts. At 6th and 23rd (right down the block) there is a great place we got breakfast called corner cafe, as well as a place called toasties at 7th and 23rd that had good and cheap breakfast. While the staff weren't overly friendly that's not what I was looking for in a hotel anyway. It was affordable, close to everything (subway stops right across the road), and clean.

Reviews.Title: “worst treatment I've ever received”
Reviews.Author: MT3_10
Reviews.Content: the unprofessional and very uncourteous way we were treated by the staff of the Chelsea Savoy hotel in Manhattan.Our arrival went as follows: -We got to the hotel at noon and at first were informed –in poor and ill-mannered English- that we had NO reservations. After I showed them a print out, they changed their minds and rudely told us that check in was after 3:00 pm. We were then told to put our 7 pieces of luggage into a cart –because there was no one in the hotel who could help us- and to return at 3:00. Upon our return, we were greeted by another person who –again very rudely- gave us our keys stating that “Our reservation was only for two nights”. I again showed him the print out, but he was uninterested saying he “would not argue with me on the matter”.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but pleasant. Very Clean. Great central location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: vibeuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights 5 days. The last time I came to NYC (2008) I stayed at the Pan American in Queens and absolutely hated it. So this time i was adamant to stay in the city on some kind of budget- at least. After a month of researching hotels in Manhattan, including reading various reviews on here, I stumbled across the Chelsea Savoy and decided to take the plunge and go for it. And boy, I have absolutely no regrets in doing so. Ok so first things first, if you are looking for luxury or is someone who is EXTREMELY picky about absolutely everything, then this hotel is not for you. Wait until you've won the lottery and stay at the Four Seasons. It's basic, but incredibly clean, especially the bathroom, which was surprisingly large. The cleaning staff here are particularly friendly so please tip them what you can. I took the 2 double beds room- as i was staying here with my dad. And i have to say, compared to many hard beds I slept in while travelling in Europe, these were quite soft and pleasant to sleep on. Basic TV in the room with HBO. Extras included an iron and ironing board and a mini fridge- Which was great considering it was 97F outside. The aircon in the room can be slightly noisey but you soon get use to it. And what's great about the air-conditioning system at this hotel is that it doesn't blow the air at you, but rather circles the air around the room and sets everything at room temperature. So if you suffer from a bad back or muscle problems, and a/cs in general usually makes things worse for you, then you don't need to worry about this one, it is very comfortable. Our room faced the back onto the court-yard and I would suggest you try and book the same, because the noise (from the street) in the front facing room I heard can be quite annoying. I'll concede that the staff are not exactly the most talkative and friendliest bunch, but they do their job and they do it fairly well in my opinion. Whenever we had a slight problem with something in the hotel, it was usually sorted out pretty quickly. The complimentary breakfast is basic by American standards, but for us Europeans it is more than perfectly adequate. They have Tetly tea there and coffee. But if its not enough for you, then there are plenty of cheap and cheerful cafes near by. There's a bar next door called Jake's Saloon... So if you fancy a beer you can just pop in there. In terms of food, you really need not worry. Vegetarian, kosher etc... They have it all within the little block this hotel is in. A little tip for those staying here, there is an organic food store literally across the street from where the number 1 subway is. They have a fresh hot buffet every day, rice with red kidney beans, roast potatoes, spicy chicken wings etc. And after 7.30 in the evening, the buffet is half price ($7.99 at other times). So we took our food from there most times and it was delicious. But if you fancy an Indian, there's one there thats less than a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Thai food on the block etc. I could not ask for a better location. We literally walked everywhere as everything was near us. Time Square and Madison Square Gardens were literally a 15- 20 minute walk straight up from the hotel. I mean you can't ask for better than that for Manhattan. So all in all I had a fantastic time here at this hotel. If you want a basic but clean hotel, thats near to everything you could possibly want to be near to in NYC, than really you wouldn't go wrong by booking this hotel. Although I really shouldn't be saying this because as soon as the word is out on this gem of a place, the prices will go through the roof! Damn it don't come... Go to Pan American in Queens instead LOL... Just kidding.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: somewhereoutthere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and have no complaints. The room and bathroom are fairly big for NYC standard and are quite clean, no bed bugs! Breakfast each morning is decent with fresh coffee, tea and pastry. Location is great, close to the subway and Penn Station, and just south of Times Square. I like staying in Chelsea better than Time Square, it is not as hectic and the restaurant are great local eatery with good food and much cheaper!! I will definitely stay here again next time I am in NYC especially if I can get a good rate. My only minus is the front desk people are very business-like, seems cold and not too friendly. I only talk to them during check in and out so I never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooked gem in NYC - great central location!”
Reviews.Author: booklovr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great -we stayed from the 17th until the 21st of August. The rooms are a good size, the bathroom is spacious (especially by NYC standards) and the beds are comfy. The breakfast was alright and the maids were really good, especially Lena (sp?). The desk staff were not unfriendly but were busy with all the things to do that running a hotel entails. I would not hesitate to stay here again - good rates, good service and close to everything you want to get to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fiendishly
Reviews.Content: had a fab stay at the Chelsea Savoy and would recommend it highly. We arrived way too early to check in and my bags were whisked away to be looked after, very professionally. Awesome location - we used cabs (central location so good value to just about anywhere :) buses (M7, M20 and M23 right outside door) and subway (again, right outside door). really enjoyed muffins, pastries, bagels and good coffee for breakfast. Very good choice of restaurants, bars and inexpensive food close to the hotel. Nice toiletries, clean and suprisingly spacious room. Icy-cold air con :)

Reviews.Title: “had a nice stay at Chelsea Savoy”
Reviews.Author: nickfromParis
Reviews.Content: had a very good week at the Chelsea Savoy: it's true to say that the people at the reception are not particularly warm and friendly , but they were answering to the phone all the time ,they were kind and helpful and found me a room at a reasonable price for a friend who was next door ,at the chelsea hotel in a ridiculously expensive room ; of course , it is not the grand hotel ,but the room was quite , comfortable , with everything i could need and axpect from an hotel of such price( i.e.not expensive for the neighbourhood ), in fact there are 2 subway stations both sides and it is very handy to move around NYC ,with direct subway from and to the airport; the bahroom was well equipped and well entertained ,the cleaning lady was efficient; i would recommend this hotel , one of the best price quality rate as far as i saw in NYC and according to the room rates!

Reviews.Title: “A good basic hotel if only service wasn't that bad”
Reviews.Author: dantheman_nz
Reviews.Content: First thing, breakfast was surprisingly good. Warm, plentiful, and three or four different pastries and bagels. That is if you get there early, leave it too late you'll get nothing, literally, although they get restocked. Apart from that there is nothing positive about this property. The front desk people are rude, inattentive. You'll see them talk among themselves all the time, or smoking outside ignoring their guests. They dress smartly, but they are only interested on themselves, they are not making any attempt to help or even show any interest on the guests. I wonder whether the owner of this property aware of this behaviour or is the owner actually one of these individuals. The property is run-down, at the floor we were staying every second light bulb on the corridor was out, you can count that one of the lift being out of service. There is only one ice machine, at the ground floor. The blankets looked old and had holes. No free wi-fi, you'll have to sign up and pay one of the providers. Location wise, it's not too bad. there is a subway entrance next to the hotel for traveling uptown and across the road for traveling downtown. I'd suggest that you'd spend a bit more and do not stay at this property. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - Clean and Bug Free!”
Reviews.Author: ParanoidAboutBugs
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the Chelsea Savoy by calling (better rates than online). While it's not luxurious, it's perfectly fine (remodeled bathrooms, nice firm beds), and more important, it's scrupulously clean. My husband and I were utterly paranoid about bed bugs. We picked Chelsea Savoy b/c it was cheap and had no hits on the bed bug sites. We still packed a flashlight and brushed up on how to check a room for an infestation. When we checked in, we left our bags in the tub and took the room apart. We stripped the bed, down to the mattress (which was zipped into a protective bag - a good sign), the drawers, the interior of the closet, under the bed (we moved it, tipped it over, etc, etc). We examined every sheet and pillow and pillowcase. We looked behind pictures. Not only was the room bug-free, it was cleaner than my house. We found dust behind the bed, but every other surface was spotless. We remade the bed and slept there confident that the hotel was well-taken-care-of, and our room was bug free. My advice? New Yorkers are a bit brusque. Deal with it. If you're looking for a clean, quiet, inexpensive room, you can't go wrong with the Chelsea Savoy. Also, a great location close to 3 subway lines, bus lines, and Madison Square Park. And pack a flashlight - better safe than sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: squigggley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel over Christmas and were very please with it overall except that a pair of new timberland boots were stole from our room. This really annoyed us .We had our money in the safe luckily . This has never happened us before and it is not nice that staff would steal from customers. We did not say anything as we felt there was not much point . I am sure they would not listen to us. They should be more selective when choosing their staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: chickenbizkit
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing price for this hotel in late May. We stayed one night while on our way to DC then returned for four nights to spend some time in NYC and to visit my brother. For what I paid - less than one fifty per night - this hotel was great. This is definitely a no frills hotel, but the room was clean and rather large for a NYC hotel - I requested two doubles since the rooms are usually bigger. What makes this hotel great is its proximity to the subway. You have access to 3 subway lines! Right around the corner of the hotel is the 1 train. One Ave west are the C/E lines and one Ave east are the F/V lines. While the hotel is not in midtown, its location was very central to all we visited since we only covered The Met and down. We were able to take the subway or walk back to the hotel to freshen up or to drop off shopping bags without any hassle or long commute. The service at the hotel was nothing special. Front desk people loved to chat amongst themselves and leave you standing there, but a loud sigh and a death stare usually snapped them out of it. The sheets and towels were a bit thin and the shower in the second room we had was VERY slow to drain. While these shortcomings may have annoyed me had I paid an outrageously high price for this hotel, I was able to dismiss them because of the hotel’s location and my room rate. The hotel has a continental breakfast which my BF tried out on the last day of our trip. He snagged some sort of doughnut which was, “just ok.” If you want a quick breakfast, walk down to Garden of Eden Gourmet (walk on 23rd towards 6th Ave – 1 minute walk). We went in wanting a little fruit cup and walked out with 2 fruit cups, yogurt, fresh apple tart, blueberry scone, and coffee. The fruit cup was cheaper and more generous than Starbucks or Au Bon Pain. This place is a cute little gourmet grocery with café and pastry counter – check it out. A few doors down from the hotel (23rd, towards 8th Ave) is a convenience store where you can grab water, sodas, tea, etc. I believe its open 24 hours. Bottom line - I highly recommend this hotel for flexible, budget travelers. If you’re a high maintenance traveler who requires room service, high quality linens, and above-average service, this place is NOT for you. Basically, go with little to no expectations and you will be pleasantly surprised –assuming you get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel, great NYC location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: jamiekravitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chelsea Savoy Hotel while visiting NYC for a Memorial Day holiday. The last time I was in New York my hotel was too close to Times Square and I wanted something a bit calmer while still being convenient to various sites and attractions in Manhattan. I also was looking for a reasonable price and didn't really care about amenities like exercise rooms, spa, etc. The hotel was doing a "spring promotion" so I got a good rate of around $140 a night, which I thought was pretty good for New York in the spring. I think the hotel was exactly as advertised - a good budget option in New York. Iniitally my room was on the second floor, which seemed awfully close to the street so I asked for a different room and got one on the 5th floor which was much better. Even facing the street, it was pretty quiet. The room was clean and comfortable, and the A/C worked great. Nothing fancy, but nothing too spartan either. The bathroom has been redone so it's got fancy counters and such, and while the bed was quite firm, I slept well. There was good wifi available but you had to pay extra for that (which I did, it worked fine). Location is terrific, with easy walking distance to Chelsea neighborhood and even up to Penn Station. The Broadway local subway 1 is right across the street and the C/E is one block away (for easy access from JFK airport by subway). I'd stay there again given the price. If it were much more I'd consider other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: jaxacctant
Reviews.Content: For the price in Manhattan, it was not too bad. Centrally located to the sites and subway system. All major subways are either across from the hotel or one block either direction. I doubt I would stay there again though. The room was not ready upon arrival, housekeeping services were late and slow (I left out for hours with sign to clean room but not done when I returned). The room was noisy from outside traffic but hey, it IS New York City. Also, the maintenance men doubled as bellman. Even though they offer a good continental breakfast, it is served in a very depressing closed bar attached to the hotel which seems to be used for storage as well. Not very conducive to enjoyment. Again, I would say that I enjoyed my trip and the hotel was adequate but would NOT stay again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jdacarbone
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great price and great location! Had a wonderful stay. Simple continental breakfast and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, friendly staff, near the subway, basic accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: teolives
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value when you need basic accommodations in the city and plan to travel by subway. The hotel is located in the Chelsea neighborhood right near the 23rd street subway station. It didn't have any amenities other than a bar next to the lobby where free coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and breakfast pastries were available every morning. Internet access was available for a fee. The room was clean and had two double platform beds (watch out for those wooden corners!) a small TV in an armoire, a desk and chair, two nighstands, a clock radio, a telephone, and a closet. The en suite bathroom had a granite countertop around the sink, but the mirror was missing a small chunk near the bottom, there were some cracked floor tiles, and the lighting was a flourescent tube. The towels were standard white hotel issue, nothing fancy. The staff were friendly and helpful and service was great. The hotel felt safe, although two members of our group reported seeing a bleeding man slumped over in the 23rd St. subway station at 10:30pm on a Friday night (they alerted the station attendant to get the man some help). There were restaurants and shops within easy walking distance of the hotel. Our room was a corner room and had two windows. The upside of that was we had good views. The downside was that street noise was pronounced, i.e., it sounded like the windows were open even when they were not. Bring earplugs if you need it quiet when you sleep. The room had an individual heating/cooling unit, so you could control the temperature and fan speed. Soap, shampoo, lotion, a showercap, and mouthwash were provided in the bathroom. There was a soda vending machine in the bar, but no food vending machines. Free maps of the city were available in the lobby. The hotel will hold your bags if you arrive prior to check in time or depart well after you check out, so that was convenient and saved us having to lug our suitcases around the streets. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: Denno32806
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel clean rooms good staff and great location.close to everything and metro right outside the door

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: kletck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awful. First, let me just say that I booked it thinking it was a budget hotel - based on many excellent reviews - so I didn't have particularly high expectations staring out. However, the price they had initially quoted me over the phone was much lower than what we ended up paying. The hotel staff was incredibly rude when we asked for an itemized statement upon checking in. I then asked about good places to eat, and they couldn't come up with any! I mean, really? It's NYC, and the hotel is located in such a fun, hip neighborhood - there were at least 20 places within reasonable walking distance that they could have recommended. The bed was the hardest I've slept on - a wooden plank would have been more comfortable. And to top it off, the street noise was almost unbearable in our room. I have stayed in hostels better than this hotel and I most definitely won't be a repeat customer. For the price we ended up paying, we probably could have found a much better quality hotel. The only perk is that it was bedbug-free...

Reviews.Title: “Super Location and exceded expectations”
Reviews.Author: 6rhinos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 15yr old daughter stayed at the Chelsea Savoy Hotel Oct 14-19. Stayed in a double room with 2 beds. By far the best hotel I have stayed in for the $$$. I was afraid the rooms would be small based on other properties we reserched before we left. To our suprise the were very roomy. Bathroom was big and the shower had good water pressure. The staff was very nice and helpful. The elevator, halls and rooms were impecably clean. Excellent location. Step outside and there is the Subway... Awsome location. We went everywhere we could for our quick 5 days. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Basic”
Reviews.Author: Schipholio
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chelsea Savoy for three days Oct 2-5. Checking in was easy and fast. The staff was courteous and check in was simple. My room was on the 5th floor and away from the noise down on 23rd street. The room was very basic and spot-free. The only thing- the room was a bit small... however you don't go to NYC to sit in a room all day so I didn't mind. The elevator was a bit slow but again nothing major. The complimentary continental breakfast was pasties and coffee but there are dozens of places in the Chelsea area to eat any time of the day or night. It's steps away from all the major subway lines both uptown and downtown... and midtown is only 2 stops away. The bed wasn't very soft but the shower was clean- plenty of towels, toiletries and other hotel staples were stocked. Check out took about 30 seconds and the staff was again very helpful. I've seen other reviews complaining about the noise, but it's NYC... it's always noisy but not so much you can't sleep... try to request a room on the 4th, 5th or 6th floor if you're concerned. It's a lively area and Chelsea stays up late.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and Good”
Reviews.Author: Kenbone
Reviews.Content: Cost only 190USD a night, with free pastry and coffee, tea breakfast. centralised location to Time Square, Empire State and many places :D

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel, to be sure”
Reviews.Author: bekeson77
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, to be sure. It deserves credit for being clean and for a really nice complimentary continental breakfast, as well as great subway access. That said, unless you want to sleep on mattresses that are hard as rocks, use threadbare linens, and have a choice between listening to neighboring rooms' toilets flushing all night long or the rattle of a poor air conditioner, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: superharley
Reviews.Content: I have been in NYC many times & stayed in many hotels, besides the big chains hotels (Millenium Times square, Double tree, Hilton, Sofitel and Marriott, Park Plaza), this is THE BEST hotel I've stayed in!!!, very nice quiet room (ask for the ones not facing the street!!), for NYC standards quite large too!!! with clean bathroom & a small refrigerator inside. The location is the best 23rd st. between 7th and 8th aves. so..... you have the red line on 7th and the blue lines on the 8th, so trains runing at all times you have access from anywhere!! this time I arrived to Penn Station and took the 1 to the 23rd, the hotel is above the station.!! The breakfast is not that fancy but you have pastries and coffee!, very nice deli on the corner of 23rd and 8th ave. One thing I have to say is that the bed is really hard ( I read it on reviews!!), nevertheless is confortable. Hey for the money you cannot find a better deal!, my rate was 125.00 plus taxes!!!, at the end of my stay I did make another reservation for thanksgiving week, this one obviously at a very different rate but when you compared with other hotels still a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up! Very Affordable. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: aasnyder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a decent hotel right in the middle of it all without having to pay a ton considering we weren't going to be in the hotel very much and we stayed an entire week, which can be very expensive. This place was perfect, it was so cheap (about $175-185/night) without looking and feeling cheap. The room we stayed in was very clean, up to date, comfortable and quiet. The front desk was quick to check us in and helpful when we had questions. We spent very little time in our room but it was perfect. We felt safe and really have no complaints about the place. Right outside, just across the street is an entrance to the subway, very convenient. Highly recommend if you don't want to spend a lot on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good hotel to stay close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: SGokul78
Reviews.Content: Stay at the hotel was a pleasant experience. The staff extended a warm welcome and had our room ready when we entered the hotel. The room was very clean and good. Its quite close to Times square (3 stations). You can get an MTA right next to the station (I mean it, there is a subway once you come out of the hotel). Its nicely located on the intersection of 7 Ave and West 23rd street. You also have a good supermarket 1 minute walk from the hotel which is open till 11 pm. Our overall experience was very pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: gr8deadfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night in April of 2009, and the Chelsea Savoy had no problem taking a booking for Saturday night only, which not many other hotels were willing to do. A lot of the other reviews here mentioned poor service, but the two people working at the desk Saturday afternoon welcomed us as soon as we walked in and we very cordial and polite the whole time we were there. The rooms still have that funky "just painted" smell, but after a few minutes, you don't notice it at all. The bathroom was big (as others mentioned) for New York City standards. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The hotel literally sits on top of the 1 and 9 line's 23rd st. subway station and is a block away (east) from the B/D/F/V or (west) A/C/E subway lines so you can be practically anywhere in Manhattan within 20 mins or so. We were on the second floor and still had no problems sleeping with the street noise, but others might notice it. As others have mentioned, the breakfast is nothing special, just pastries and coffee/tea. There is no restaurant at the hotel (as of 4/2009), but there are about 3 or 4 decently priced diners within a block in either direction, so it's no big deal. The hotel was more than happy to keep our bag for the afternoon after we checked out. The deal maker for this hotel is the price. We paid $125 for a queen bed on a Saturday night - extremely low by Manhattan standards and an incredible value for the money! We will be back to the Savoy on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chelsea Savoy”
Reviews.Author: anniez39
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent a long weekend at the Chelsea Savoy a couple of weeks ago. It was great - very clean, nice and roomy, quiet, a great street with great deli, grocery, pharmacy, etc. all nearby. It is between 2 subway stops, very convenient. The breakfast was good with delicious pastries, muffins and good coffee. Another friend was in a nearby chain hotel and paid 3 times as much for less room, and no breakfast! I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lindsaynf
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying the Chelsea Savoy is in a great location and was completely convenient for our walk to FIT. It also is close to the subway stations and has decent little shops and restaurants around it. However, the customer service was absolutely horrible! I've never felt so UNWELCOME in a hotel. The staff never greets you when you walk in and when we approached the front desk to ask questions, we even received dirty looks (and this was before they knew what our question was!)! It didn't matter what crew was working either, they were all rude! Our room keys got deactivated multiple times and in order to activate one they must give you a whole other set of keys (very frustrating when you're in a hurry). One big aspect that added to this was when we first arrived it was too early to get in our room so we checked our luggage and ventured off. When we came back, the staff member brought down the cart filled with our luggage and left it there for us to take up ourselves! Mind you, we are 3 younger women left with over 150 pounds of luggage to take up to the rooms. We are very capable of doing it, but I've never been to a $300/night hotel that has left this task for the guests to finish. To sum up, the location was convenient for this particular trip, but the service has helped me decide that I will never book the Chelsea Savoy again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our NY stay.”
Reviews.Author: loves-to-travel76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I walked by this hotel the last time we were in NYC and due to its perfect location we decided that we would stay here the next time. And so we did. The hotel is clean and cheap by NYC standard and it has everyting you need. We loved that the room had a little fridge. Rooms are not large by american standard, but compared to average rooms in Europe, the size is great. The so called breakfast is so-so, but it doesn't matter as there are plenty of nearby places to have breakfast. There are also many good restaurants and bars within walking distance and the area seams very safe. You can easily walk to most tourist attractions during the day. The only problem is the traffic noise, but I guess that that's the case in most NYC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the price”
Reviews.Author: skeenyvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked into the Hotel Chelsea (aka the Chelsea Hotel) for 6 nights in September. It is half a block down from the Chelsea Savoy Hotel, but were so disgusted with the place that I spent almost two hours online and calling around the next morning to find another reasonably price hotel. I despondently walked down the block to get a coffee and stumbled upon the Chelsea Savoy Hotel. I walked in and found a clean lobby and friendly staff. They only had a smoking room available for the first night, but a king, non-smoking room was available for the rest of our stay. I checked out the smoking room and was pleasantly surprised to find a room with new carpet, nice furnishings including a mini fridge, a great bathroom and best of all, no smell of smoke. We stayed there the first night, then moved to the king, non-smoking room the next day. The beds were firm, the rooms quite and the water hot. Perfect for the price of $185 for the queen room and $205 for the king room. The rate also included coffee/tea and pastries each morning. We grabbed a bagel and tea/coffee on our way out--fresh, warm and wonderfully chewy bagels. The front desk staff was particularly helpful, taking me up to see several rooms when I first arrived, to assisting with directions, shopping suggestions, luggage storage and more. It is not a 4 or 5 star hotel, but overall, we had a great experience and would definitely recommend the Chelsea Savoy (NOT the Hotel Chelsea--run from this place!) to anyone looking for reasonably priced accommodation in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “This place RIPS YOU OFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelfanDC
Reviews.Content: I booked/reserved my room 1 month in advance and was quoted a rate of $185. When I arrived They were charging me $265. When I complained that that was not the rate I was quoted ONE MONTH BEFORE WHEN I RESERVED. A woman that should be fired and who said she is the ONLY one who takes reservations...said "you don't have a reservation...oh wait...you booked it yesterday...oh wait you did book it one month in advance but I did not take that reservation and so it is the rate I am telling you. You want to stay somewhere else...fine be my guest" When I asked to speak to a Manager I was told "There are no managers". I am not making this stuff up. So...If you don't mind a staff that could care less that you live or die and is willing to steal your money. You should stay here. Don't believe me? Read a few of the other reviews here. Since there seems to be nothing else I can do about this I guess I am trying to do what I can to let others know.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: sidramichon
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good, clean hotel near the Fashion Institute and was very happy with my choice of The Chelsea Savoy. The rooms are small, but then most are in NY unless you are willing to spend a lot (more) money. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were redone a few years back. Each morning they provide coffee, tea, hot choc and assorted breakfast danishes and bagels, which beats having to get dressed to go out and get that wake-up cup of coffee. There is a subway stop directly across the street and Penn Station is a short walk. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustJayb
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at this hotel and was very impressed with the service and cleanliness. The room I stayed at had 2 beds and was very large and even had a small refrigerator. Price was very reasonable considering what some hotels in New York get. Very good location near subways and restaurants. Staff was very accommodating. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Down Right RUDE Front Desk Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsufan1989
Reviews.Content: RUDE RUDE RUDE front desk staff. My first and last time staying there. The girl who waited on me should find another job cause she sure seems miserable there. Not to mention the nasty and dirty carpet in the rooms. I also payed for the internet service they provide and it only worked 1/4 of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FancyOne73
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Chelsea Savoy for 3 nights, and the experience was just plain awesome! This hotel is perfectly located near everything, cab rides are cheap, and the subway stations are all within about 1 block. The service was great, and the room exceeded our expectations. Very clean, air conditioned and the newspapers waiting for us at our door every morning was a great added touch. The complimentary pastries and coffee in the lobby every morning was just the icing on the cake, it was an excellent way to start our day. This is going to be a yearly trip for us from now on and we will definitely be staying at the Savoy again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York and is looking for an affordable, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: quixotic_beat
Reviews.Content: I got a recommendation from a friend about this hotel. I took her word for it and made reservations. This hotel was great. I booked last minute and got a nicely maintained hotel. The lobby is kind of small, but the rooms are nice and spacious with AC/heater. It has a convenient location, right next to the 23rd street station downtown. Cross the street and you're at the uptown station. The staff was also very courteous and was able to answer all of my questions. The Chelsea Savoy Hotel also has complimentary breakfast and coffee and USA Today and the New Yorker (I'm pretty sure) newspapers delivered at your doorstep. However, I got a 2nd floor room right on the corner of 23rd and 7th and it got noisy at times. Also, the cable doesn't work too well and there aren't many channels. But, this is NYC! Why watch TV when there's a whole city outside? All in all, I gave this hotel a 5/5 for service, appearance, comfort, and value. Top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My least favorite NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artscribe
Reviews.Content: The positive: if you're looking for a hotel in a convenient location, you can't beat this place -- it's within steps of the 1 and 9 subways, and if you're a downtown type, it's a great launching point. The room was clean, and, for a NYC hotel, the bathroom was enormous. The staff leaves newspapers at your door (USA Today and the New York Post). The rest: Just because a place is a budget hotel doesn't mean it has to be completely uncomfortable. The room smelled like paint (and it also smelled musty). The bed and pillows were terribly uncomfortable. The coffee and danish they serve each morning couldn't have been more unappealing. The hotel contracts its internet service, and for $9.95/day, I had the opportunity to have a non-functional internet connection (I was in a room that had a very poor wireless signal). For a $100 deposit I could have had a "booster" attached to my macbook. Fortunately, there was a Starbucks across the street, and I could easily and reliably check my email and the like there. On TV, while I don't go to NYC to watch television, I was still appalled by the poor reception and lack of cable choices. It's the worst of any hotel I've visited (budget or otherwise) in NYC. Concerning the front desk staff, while I don't care about their being my new best friends, this crew was downright surly. I had originally checked in for six nights; I left after two. I've stayed in some pretty lousy hotels in NYC, but this wins the prize for the worst. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all you need”
Reviews.Author: huulu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now, and will probably not bother looking for any other hotel in Manhattan. My take on this place is the same as the others who liked it, so I won't bother repeating the same information. Both times I made my reservations over the phone and got the same price and type of room as quoted. As for the staff, they're not overly friendly but are polite and do what's asked of them. If you need to be pampered go somewhere else, but you're going to be paying a lot more than you would here.

Reviews.Title: “May 2008, $195 per night..”
Reviews.Author: anon411
Reviews.Content: I booked this room last minute, three days before depature, Rm 503. Great location. This room directly overlooked 23rd street. It was noisey and you constantly heard traffic, shouting ; ect. I'd highly recommend call the hotel directly for reservations. I filled out the online reservation form twice and got no reply. dont even think about checking in early. From what I understand, check out is late and the maid staff also comes in late. My room wasnt ready until 2pm and this was on a friday check in. The breakfast: I read many comments like.."great coffee" , "mmm coffee out of this world" ect ... but it tasted like standard generic coffee to me. Dont execpt eggs, pancakes... its all bread items , sweet and non sweet. Hotel had a hard time keeping bread and coffee stocked! Room 503 is double bed , with TV , air con and a private bathroom. Right across from the elevator. The room was clean and smelled nice. My bathroom light didnt work when I finally checked in and it was changed in under 10 minutes. This is a nice location between the subway #1 and C,E train lines. I'd highly recommend the bake shop on the corner of 8th & 23rd. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel (boston market, cuban resturant; ect) but I liked the mango/papaya spot that was diagonal across (23 & 7th).

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDerek
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Chelsea Savoy and thought it was brilliant. I thought I was going into a horrible place, but it was lovely. spotlessly clean, 2 papers outside your door every morning, staff always polite and very helpful. Have seen some reports on this hotel from Tripadivsor and I dont know where they can get their views.I always bring my own pillow and sheets with me. But when I seen the rooms and inspected the bed in this hotel they stayed in my case. SPOTLESS. Breakfast is not provided but go down to the lobby and you have all the coffee [ beautiful] and Danish you want. You cannot fault this hotel in it's price bracket. Everything is whitin 15 mins and it's clean, spotless, the staff are brilliant. Going back to New York in December and will be staying at the Chelsea Savoy,if there is room. So cheap and so comfortable and for me,,,,,,,,,so clean. Stay there. Basic...... but lovely.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: allihies
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from spending 8 nights at Chelsea Savoy. Speaking from my friend and my point of view we were more than happy with the hotel. Rooms are a good size as are bathrooms. Beds were very comfortable, good wardrobe space, plenty of hot water, tho shower pressure not too strong. My only quibble was that there were not too many power points, european visitors remember american adaptor. Rooms were cleaned daily. Hotel does not do b.fast but free v. good coffee, bagels and muffins in lobby from 8am, and plenty of delis and coffee shops in area. Contrary to other reviewers I found reception staff very friendly and helpful. Most are of Polish nationality and couldnt be nicer. To my horror I cracked a tooth on my first night, reception staff were super, located a dentist and Ava, one of staff, even offered to give me her appt. with her dentist!! All in all I would recommend the Chelsea Savoy/ Location is great, subway stop outside the door, great shopping on 16th, 17th sts between 5th and 8th avenue, esp. Loehmanns. Also on 6th Ave. and 23rd, 2 mins from hotel there is a superb organic wholefood market.!! Fab market selling cooked and raw food and products, we ate from there a lot. Cant wait to go back and will defnitely stay at Chelsea Savoy again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for sensitive types”
Reviews.Author: FroggyDude
Reviews.Content: Staff was unsmiling and all business. No sense of warmth whatsoever. There is one foreign accented woman at the front desk who was extremely rude to me when I asked her for help after I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: burdfour
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, we had some concerns, but we had a great time. Not the Hilton, but a great value for travelers who want to spend travel budget monies on something besides the room. The room was clean, seemed recently remodeled, bathroom was beautiful. Complimentary soaps, shampoo, etc, which I did not expect for the price. Complimentary continental breakfast was not much, but saved us time and money. Location was great, on the same corner as subway stop, and only a $4.90 cab ride back from Times Square. Probably walking distance to Times Square for those who like to walk. Front desk staff was friendly, and had our reservation at the quoted price, no suprizes. They were unable to extend check out, but did not kick us out when we were still packing at official check out time. Definately will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: atiny_dancer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several other "budget" hotels in the city, and have never been as happy as I was that the Chelsea Savoy. Quiet, clean, extremely affordable for NYC, easy access to subway, continental breakfast every morning, 2 newspapers delivered to your door Monday-Friday, small fridge in room, private bathroom, soft beds, laundromat just 2 blocks away (very helpful for long stays), helpful and curtious front desk, and free luggage storage. If you looking for a basic place to stay, that's quiet, clean, affordable, and easy access to all the city has to offer, this is the place. I plan on staying here again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricardamus
Reviews.Content: Positive: large and clean rooms, very good location (some steps from subway); Negative: some of people staff are unhelpful; bad lightning in the room

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy, But Very Clean & Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: MintyFresh1346
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York and I was not sure what to expect. Turns out I love New York and the Chelsea Savoy is actually a great hotel. I went with 2 friends and we looked at MANY hotels online trying to decide which to pick. The hotel was so reasonably priced compared to others I thought there had to be something wrong and we'd find out it was actually a really scarey place when we got there. I am happy to report our experience was really good. The room was #609. The hotel is not fancy at all, but it was clean and our room had space to spare with 2 double beds and one fold away bed we had asked for. The bathroom was a good size and had lots of counter space. The closet also was a good size and had a safe in it. The room did seem to have an odor of some kind....Like a new carpet smell...but we had no problems with it. Each morning we had newspapers outside our door and the coffee and pastry found in the lobby were nice to have when getting ready to face the day. The staff were friendly and efficient. They held our luggage after our checkout on the last day until we were ready to go to the airport. I know I'll be back to New York and I know I'll stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Decent, but not without problems”
Reviews.Author: futurenygirl
Reviews.Content: When I stayed, most other hotels nearby were booked so I was happy to find a hotel for around $250 a night. I stay in NYC almost every month so I know it can be hard to find a good hotel for that price and I wasn't expecting too much. I had read previous reviews talking about a strong smell but they were from June/July so I figured by August the smell would be gone! The room was basic and clean and actually quite spacious by NY standards. I think the ceilings are higher than normal too. No flat screen tv, just a regular one, but I don't come to NY to watch TV! The main problem was that the room smelled like it was freshly painted. It was STRONG! On top of that there were flies in the room (presumably because they had the window open to air it out but the screen had a hole in it so flies came in). I have almost no sense of smell so it didn't bother me that much, but my friend is very sensitive to things like that and kept having to go downstairs every hour or so to "air out." We asked down at the desk and the woman there said it hadn't been painted recently. Later, after a shift change, we asked the guy at the desk and he said it HAD been painted.
